channel.title: How do i prepare to everything
channel.description:
Hello, im new here, since i pissed of leeching rsps servers and clients,adding code that i dont know even how it works etc, i really need help there, couse i want create something from basic my questions:
How to prepare yourself (mind) for java programming? I know that most of you using eclipse ide how do i setup it for any rsps base? What base i should choose for beggining,i have choosed pi, but since theres many tutorials, i dont want to use any created source copy/paste , i want create them self? How to create yourself code ,like skills,following etc compatible with client. How everythings works in rsps i mean how to make everything from scratch? please picture tutorial , my english is terrible and im to dumb to think logically Is there any commands library like in other programming languages? [b]Is there any lithuanians in this community? java in lithuanian language would be useful[/b]
short things about me: i have never used any programming language, i just read that things exist like ,C# ,C++ ,pascal ,Vb net?,php,html things what i want to create: 474 server with client ,also working mysql loging, even dont know how to use lol
Things i have done ,installed jdk 7,jre 7, setup enviroment variables for javac,downloaded and installed eclipse ide.
Things i want to learn: how to use database (mysql) with server,start scripting from scratch , create following system ,talking npcs , i will dedicate my years for coding, if you help , dont post bullshit how to use google, theres too much info for me i dont know what should i pick , let me know what should i choose.
appreciate any reply..
regards,
forum mate.
p.s please move this topic if i posted in wrong section,sorry.

item.title: How do i prepare to everything
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

Maybe you should buy a java book, they have helped many people in this community become accustomed to java.

Gal jums reikia nusipirkti java knyga, jie padėjo daug žmonių šioje bendruomenėje, priprasti į Java.

http://www.amazon.co.uk/Head-First-Java-Kathy-Sierra/dp/0596009208

I also suggest that you revise your English before engaging in serious discussion on this forum.

[quote=“Classic_, post:6, topic:431890”]l0000000000000l HOW TO PREPARE YOUR MIND FOR JAVA OOOOOOOOOOOLLLLLL
must be some nigger-asian physic mind fuck[/quote]

I thought the same.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i prepare to everything

item.title: How do i prepare to everything
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

You won’t learn java from rsps or at least not proper java. Start out with java tutorials then work your way to rsps.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i prepare to everything

item.title: How do i prepare to everything
item.dc:creator: @kileedyg kileedyg
item.description:
@kileedyg wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:8, topic:431890”][quote author=kileedyg link=topic=534598.msg3908517#msg3908517 date=1328466100]

I know that most of you using eclipse ide how do i setup it for any rsps base?

new project

What base i should choose for beggining,i have choosed pi, but since theres many tutorials, i dont want to use any created source copy/paste , i want create them self?

I suggest writing your own classes after looking at some real java tutorials.

How to create yourself code ,like skills,following etc compatible with client.

Do step above first

How everythings works in rsps i mean how to make everything from scratch? please picture tutorial , my english is terrible and im to dumb to think logically

in this day and age you won’t make it from “scratch” sorry.

Is there any lithuanians in this community? java in lithuanian language would be useful

java is universal you can make your own variables in whatever language. giveLIfe is the same as blahBlah if you wanted.

I suggest writing your own classes after looking at some real java tutorials.

how do i write classes? is this pointless in my future rsps developing,also i even dont know commands etc, i know few things public ,bracers ,intenger? also rsps will be my first progress in java language so i want stick with it .

[quote]
java is universal you can make your own variables in whatever language. giveLIfe is the same as blahBlah if you wanted.[/quote]

Thanks ,but i need detailed info, i will keep alive this topic when i got everything to start my own thingies.

Also thanks for your reply
[/quote]It’s hard to say when a person is ready to start creating their own classes… it depends on how fast you grasp the main concepts of java or any programming language for that matter. Just follow and read java tutorials online for at least a good two weeks to get a good hold of what you need to know. There are also books that can be bought.[/quote]

I will start building basic java programms but is it usefull in my future rsps developing i mean i learn few commands etc, is rsps base diffrent from main java language,can i use same methods? thanks for your reply

[quote=“Classic_, post:6, topic:431890”]l0000000000000l HOW TO PREPARE YOUR MIND FOR JAVA OOOOOOOOOOOLLLLLL
must be some nigger-asian physic mind fuck[/quote]

Thanks for wasting your time at reading my topic.

Read full topic

How everythings works in rsps i mean how to make everything from scratch? please picture tutorial , my english is terrible and im to dumb to think logically

in this day and age you won’t make it from “scratch” sorry.

Is there any lithuanians in this community? java in lithuanian language would be useful

java is universal you can make your own variables in whatever language. giveLIfe is the same as blahBlah if you wanted.
[/quote]

I suggest writing your own classes after looking at some real java tutorials.

how do i write classes? is this pointless in my future rsps developing,also i even dont know commands etc, i know few things public ,bracers ,intenger? also rsps will be my first progress in java language so i want stick with it .

[quote]
java is universal you can make your own variables in whatever language. giveLIfe is the same as blahBlah if you wanted.[/quote]

Thanks ,but i need detailed info, i will keep alive this topic when i got everything to start my own thingies.

Also thanks for your reply :)[/quote]It’s hard to say when a person is ready to start creating their own classes… it depends on how fast you grasp the main concepts of java or any programming language for that matter. Just follow and read java tutorials online for at least a good two weeks to get a good hold of what you need to know. There are also books that can be bought.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“kileedyg, post:3, topic:431890”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=534598.msg3908466#msg3908466 date=1328464287]
cool
Read oracles documentation of java or somfink like that
[/quote]

thanks for your reply, so i got java scheme there - http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/ it will useful in future developing if i get it, but i stuck at What’s New in Documentation

Documentation is regularly updated to provide developers with in-depth information about new features in the Java platform. Some recent updates include:

im not developer ,im begginer,also its kinda tricky.[/quote]
Well, your gonna develop with it, amirite?

Read full topic
